intro: Oenothera dissecta, commonly known as the dissected evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and delicate, yellow-orange flowers that bloom at night. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are finely dissected, giving it a feathery appearance. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Oenothera dissecta is part of the Onagraceae family, which includes other evening primrose species.
